DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to represent the overall disease response in a target or non-target lesion, using RECIST response criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information relating to the overall lesion response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Including everything.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: irRECIST: Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2013
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/7/18 jk added irRECIST CSI.  8/30/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)._Including everything._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Overall Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):Including everything.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 12/9/19 jk Added PV "Not done" for DCI use case where both Target (6148980) and Non-Target (6152826) Overall is set to "Not Done" for a given timepoiont.  10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard for RECIST defined PV list; do not add PVs without checking latest version of guideline.  3/23/18 jk added "Inevaluable" as alt VM to NE. 8/30/17 tt transferred context, versioned/PVs, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/1/16 jk released per Dianne Reeves as part of RECIST content.  8/12/13 jc created for RECISTv1.1 CRF module.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Round5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Overall response status at this evaluation

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Overall RECIST response status at this evaluation

DataElement.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/30/17 tt CDE versioned for change to VD and question; transferred Context, changed reg status and released per Round 5 finalization task. 3/1/16 jk released per Dianne Reeves as part of RECIST content.  9/1/15 made timepoint 2 words in pref quest text. jk 11/20/13 changed origin to RECISTv1.1. jc  9/29/13 updated timepoint to single word. jc 8/22/13 upd quest text for column labels in RECIST tables 1, 2, and 3.  jc  8/20/13 created for RECIST CRF module; values based on definitions in RECISTv1.1 guideline. jc
